Beinn Ime

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Beinn Ime is the highest of the Arrochar Alps. Usually ascended by its broad southern slopes from the Bealach a'Mhaim, the other sides of the mountain are much steeper and more rugged.

 You have not climbed Beinn Ime.

Region: Loch Lomond

Altitude: 1011 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.36/5
Rating: 3.4/5 (184 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Beinn Ime and Beinn Narnain from Arrochar

Other routes and challenges

Many walkers often add an ascent The Cobbler to the above route.

A much more strenuous and demanding option is to include Ben Vane as a third Munro on the round, but the ground between Ime and Vane is steep and very rough. Finally, Ben Ime can be ascended in combination with the Corbett, Beinn Luibhean.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Arrochar Hotels

Arrochar B&B

Arrochar Cottages

Loch Lomond Hostels

Panoramic summit view (click to open)
